text: (upbeat music)

- FactSet's mission is to
be the leading open platform
for both content and analytics

across a wide variety of
financial services clients.
There were a number of challenges

around managing physical
resources to meet scale.
There were challenges around ETL and data.
So moving data from our end to the client

involved these large processes
that took sometimes hours

and involved a number of
different team members

on the client side and
a number of individuals
on the FactSet side to support.

Anytime there was an issue,
it was hard to figure out

at what part of the process
the data movement went wrong.

This just created a huge
amount of inefficiency.

What we see now, though,
with our partnership

with Amazon Redshift,
we've been able to witness
a number of success stories
and getting rid of that long process
from extracting the data,
from moving it to where it needs to go,
and from all these downstream dependencies
where time and money was wasted.
And so it's really exciting to see clients

take advantage of this as it
allows them to scale faster,
bring on more data to meet their needs,
and radically makes our lives easier too,
because with a few clicks of the button

we're able to deliver
massive amounts of data
to our clients.
And what we're really excited about

is the integration of Redshift
on the Amazon Data Exchange.

What this will do is
further remove friction
associated with data onboarding.

It's gonna make things like
billing more transparent
and easier to manage for our clients.

And it's gonna really
improve the user experience
for those interested in browsing content
and finding the data that they need,

sourcing it from trusted
partners like FactSet.
